page.title: 14South Moreton Mill
page.content: There were apparently two mills along the Mill Brook. The present owner of the remaining mill, Mrs Miller, says that the mill race may still be seen with its wheel but it no longer works, the last time it did so was 1923 but according to Budd Finch, an 86yr old inhabitant of the area, the mill was then used for corn grinding for local farmers but not for bread making. One of the mills, that downstream, seems to have produced paper at one stage in its history. There is a claim that it was at South Moreton Paper Mill in the nineteenth century that blotting paper was first discovered. There also seems to be some idea that one of the mills may have been used as an isolation Hospital either during an outbreak of Plague in 1603 or perhaps during the Napoleonic Wars.
